titleStmt.title: Description of British Library, Or 2737: Hagadah for Passover according to the Spanish rite (the 'Hispano-Moresque Hagadah').

notesStmt.note: Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Hagadah for Passover according to the Spanish rite (the 'Hispano-Moresque Hagadah').

msItem.title: Hagadah for Passover according to the Spanish rite (the 'Hispano-Moresque Hagadah').

layoutDesc.layout: Columns: 1; ruled lines: 12; written lines: 12; Hard-point ruling is visible. Hair-side and flesh-side of the folios are distinguishable. Has many illuminations and illustrations, which consist mainly of gold and coloured letters and designs. Some parts of the text are written in red ink.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sephardi square script, punctuated, of the last quarter of the 13th century or 1st quarter of the 14th century, c. 1300.

binding.p: Post-1600. Black leather. Spine: 'Haggada. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2737.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Hayim Horowitz: purchased by the British Museum from him on 26 January 1884 (paper flyleaf of the back binding).
